text.__SUMMARY__: Rhododendron molle (羊踯躅) is a rhododendron species native to China and Japan, where it grows at altitudes of sea level to 2500 meters. It is a shrub that grows to 0.5–2 m in height, with leaves that are oblong to oblong-lanceolate,  5–11 by 1.5–3.5 cm in size. Flowers are yellow with dark red flecks.
text.Synonyms:
Azalea mollis Blume
Rhododendron sinense (Lodd.) Sweet
text.References:
"Rhododendron molle", (Blume) G. Don, Gen. Hist. 3: 846. 1834.
